nl_problem:
# Task: matrix_chain_multiplication
# Interface:
Class: Solution
Method: matrixChainOrder(self, arg1)

Given a list of matrix dimensions, find the minimum number of scalar multiplications needed to multiply the sequence of matrices.
If the sequence of matrices is A1, A2, ..., An, where Ai has dimensions `p[i-1] x p[i]`, the input is the list `p = [p0, p1, ..., pn]`.

Constraints:
- 2 <= p.length <= 100
- 1 <= p[i] <= 100
lisp_spec:
(task
  (name "matrixChainOrder")
  (signature ( (p list) ) int)
  (constraints
    (constraint "The length of the list p must be between 2 and 100.")
    (constraint "Each element in the list p must be between 1 and 100.")
  )
  (goal
    (description "Find the minimum number of scalar multiplications needed to multiply a sequence of matrices.")
    (rule "The input list p contains dimensions of matrices where p[i] represents the dimension of matrix Ai as p[i-1] x p[i].")
    (return "An integer representing the minimum number of scalar multiplications required.")
  )
)
